event.title: 1640, a community of English immigrants was established

data.event: In 1640, a community of English immigrants was established by residents of Hartford, making Farmington the oldest inland settlement west of the Connecticut River and the twelfth oldest communities in the state.

event.title: were given their present names in 1645

data.event: The town and river were given their present names in 1645, which is considered the incorporation year of the town.
